item.title: Biden Races to Trump-Proof His Agenda
item.description: Trump made unprecedented use of a 1996 law to overturn Obama-era regulations. Biden’s aides hope to stop the Republican from doing it again if he wins.

item.title: Gold Futures Rise on Promising U.S. Economic Data
item.description: Gold futures rose 1% on improved hopes for U.S. interest rate cuts after promising economic data on Friday.

item.title: Israel Tells Gazans to Evacuate Rafah Neighborhoods Ahead of Planned Offensive
item.description: The message warns of a military offensive to rout Hamas in the southern Gazan city after cease-fire talks faltered.

item.title: Oil Rises as Ceasefire Hopes Dim, Saudi Arabia Lifts Crude Prices
item.description: Oil was higher as ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas showed little progress and Saudi Arabia lifted its official selling prices for June loadings for most regions.

item.title: European Stocks Rise as Prospects of Earlier U.S. Rate Cut Pick Up
item.description: European stocks opened higher after Friday’s weaker-than-expected U.S. jobs data increased prospects the Federal Reserve could cut interest rates, potentially by September.

item.title: Dollar Recovers Much of Its Losses After Weak U.S. Jobs Data
item.description: UniCredit said the dollar’s recovery following Friday’s post-data losses was helped by the fact the prices paid component of the ISM survey jumped to nearly 60, suggesting that inflation pressures remain.

item.title: Vinci Begins CEO Succession Plan With Appointment of New COO
item.description: Vinci has appointed company veteran Pierre Anjolras as chief operating officer, marking the first step in the process to name a successor for chief executive Xavier Huillard, whose term will end next year.

item.title: China Services-Sector Gauge Shows Slower Activity Expansion
item.description: A private gauge of China’s services sector showed activity grew at a slightly slower pace in April, though there are signs of a recovery in consumption given strong spending over recent holidays.

item.title: EQT to Buy U.S. Digital Consultancy Perficient for $3 Billion
item.description: Swedish private-equity firm EQT said it will pay $76 a share, a 58% premium to Perficient’s closing price on Friday.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Weakness in April Was Mainly Driven by U.S. Treasurys
item.description: Eurozone government bonds remained primarily stuck in a bond-negative pull in April, emanating from the Treasury market, LBBW said.

item.title: Atos Considers Four Restructuring Offers
item.description: Atos said the proposals were from a group of bondholders and banks, Bain Capital, EP Equity Investment and Onepoint, adding that it had signed a $108 million interim financing deal with bondholders.

item.title: Li Auto Shares Gain on Strong L6 Orders
item.description: Li Auto shares rose sharply after the Chinese electric-vehicle maker posted strong orders for its first model priced under 300,000 yuan, or the equivalent of nearly $41,452.

item.title: Why Student Protesters Want Columbia to Cut Ties With Google and Amazon
item.description: Many student protesters are demanding schools drop Israel investments. WSJ explores the history of divestment movements at universities and the challenges involved in modern divestment initiatives.

item.title: Why the Fed Is Right to Bide Its Time on Rate Moves
item.description: Not that critics of Jerome Powell’s latest move don’t have some good points, says Streetwise columnist James Mackintosh.

item.title: China's Xi Shouldn't Expect an Easy Ride in Europe This Time
item.description: The Chinese leader’s visit is set to test Europe’s willingness to confront Beijing over its support of Russia and trade practices that have hurt European industries.

item.title: Households Wince at the Rising Price of Going Green
item.description: Clean-energy rules carry new taxes and stiff penalties. In Paris, flunking an energy-efficiency inspection exacts a hefty cost.

item.title: Circumstances suggest that House Speaker Mike Johnson is likely to retain the gavel should fellow Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene carry out her vow to force a floor vote on his removal.
item.description: Circumstances suggest that House Speaker Mike Johnson is likely to retain the gavel should fellow Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene carry out her vow to force a floor vote on his removal.

item.title: Talks in Cairo over a cease-fire deal ended without progress, Arab mediators said, after Hamas failed to formally respond to an Israeli-Egyptian proposal to pause the fighting in Gaza in exchange for a release of hostages.
item.description: Talks in Cairo over a cease-fire deal ended without progress, Arab mediators said, after Hamas failed to formally respond to an Israeli-Egyptian proposal to pause the fighting in Gaza in exchange for a release of hostages.

item.title: Sam Ash Music, the instrument retailer that recently announced plans to close its stores, is looking for a buyer to keep the chain and its online retail presence going, CEO Richard Ash said.
item.description: Sam Ash Music, the instrument retailer that recently announced plans to close its stores, is looking for a buyer to keep the chain and its online retail presence going, CEO Richard Ash said.

item.title: Chinese leader Xi Jinping's first visit to Europe in nearly five years is shaping up as a test of the continent's willingness to confront Beijing over its support of Russia's invasion of Ukraine as well as Chinese trade policies that have eviscerated critical European industries.
item.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s first visit to Europe in nearly five years is shaping up as a test of the continent’s willingness to confront Beijing over its support of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine as well as Chinese trade policies that have eviscerated critical European industries.
